alert.note: Alert for Schoharie; Western Albany (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 4:38PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Albany and central Schoharie Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 438 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Jefferson, or 14 miles south of Cobleskill, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cobleskill, Jefferson, Middleburgh, Summit, Schoharie, Richmondville, Livingstonville, North Blenheim, Breakabeen, Central Bridge, Rensselaerville, Baird Corners, Huntersland, Warnerville, Broome Center, Becker Corners, West Fulton, Shutts Corners, Arabia and Barnerville. This includes Interstate 88 between exits 20 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for east central New York.
